alert.note: Alert for Frederick (Maryland) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued January 09 at 2:23AM EST until January 10 at 8:42PM EST by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...The Flood Watch continues for the following rivers in Maryland... Monocacy River near Frederick affecting Frederick MD zone. For the Monocacy River...including Frederick...flooding is possible. ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY MORNING TO TOMORROW EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding is possible. * WHERE...Monocacy River near Frederick. * WHEN...From Wednesday morning to tomorrow evening. * IMPACTS...At 15.0 feet, Both banks of the river are flooded. Water begins to flood low-lying fields at Monocacy National Battlefield. Water reaches the access road of the Frederick city wastewater treatment plant. Backwater flooding is occurring on several area creeks, particularly Carroll Creek in Frederick. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:30 AM EST Tuesday the stage was 4.0 feet, or 11.0 feet below flood stage. - Forecast...Flood stage may be reached late tomorrow morning. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. - Please visit www.weather.gov/safety/flood for flood safety and preparedness information && River Name Fld Observed Tue Tue Tue Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time 7AM 1PM 7PM Stg Time Date Monocacy River Frederick 15.0 4.0 Tue 1 am 3.8 4.6 8.1 15.2 1pm Wed &&
info.instruction: If you are in the watch area, remain alert to possible flooding. Additional information is available at weather.gov/washington or weather.gov/baltimore. The next statement will be issued this morning at 1030 AM EST.
